utterances: And how long have you been playing the puzzle, Lindsy?
And do I have my information right - did you just have a baby?
She's 11 months, so we're planning her one-year-old birthday.
So, not a lot of spare time to be puzzling.
Oh, no. We make time for it in our house.
So, are you ready to do this, Lindsy?
Today's puzzle is as easy as ABC.
Every answer is an anagram of a word that has the letters ABC in it.
For example, if I said ABC plus he H-E, you'd rearrange those letters to make beach.
Number one is ABC plus is I-S.
ABC plus one - and that's O-N-E.
Your clue for this is part of a lighthouse.
And it's the light of a lighthouse.
I don't know what that's called.
What letter does it start with?
How about ABC plus fir F-I-R.
And it might be a kind of apology.
How about ABC plus mere M-E-R-E.
And it's the synonym of to hug.
How about ABC plus pole P-O-L-E.
This one starts with P as in Peter.
And it might be something a scientist gives you if you're taking part in an experiment.
That's a hard one to see.
And here's your last one: ABC plus only O-N-L-Y.
And it might be something you would have if you were on the second floor or higher of a building.
For playing the puzzle today, you will, of course, get a WEEKEND EDITION lapel pin and puzzle books and games.
